name: Lorazepam

dosing.adult_acute: Anxiety: 0.5-2 mg BID-TID PRN; Agitation: 1-2 mg IM/IV q4-6h PRN
dosing.adult_maintenance: 2-6 mg/day divided BID-TID for short-term use only
dosing.notes: Intermediate-acting; no active metabolites; IM/IV/SL/PO formulations; preferred in elderly and hepatic impairment

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Titrate to minimum effective dose; avoid regular dosing if possible
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 4-6 mg/day; use lowest effective dose for shortest duration
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Agitation: 1-2 mg IM/PO q4-6h PRN; Alcohol withdrawal: Higher doses protocol-driven
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: 0.5-1 mg PRN for anxiety; educate on dependence risk; time-limited use

warnings: Black box warning: (1) Concomitant use with opioids may result in respiratory depression, coma, death; (2) Abuse, misuse, addiction; (3) Dependence and withdrawal
Physical dependence develops with regular use (can occur within 2-4 weeks)
Withdrawal can be life-threatening - taper slowly
Avoid in pregnancy (cleft palate risk) and breastfeeding
Should be SHORT-TERM use only (<2-4 weeks); not for chronic anxiety management

cautions.renal: No adjustment needed (no active metabolites) - preferred benzodiazepine in renal impairment
cautions.hepatic: No adjustment (glucuronidation, no active metabolites) - preferred benzodiazepine in hepatic impairment
cautions.pregnancy: Pregnancy Category D - avoid; associated with cleft palate
